oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Captain James Pierre Drouillard in Civil War uniform, n.d.
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: An undated copy photograph of United States Army Captain James Pierre Drouillard, an 1861 graduate of West Point and an officer of the United States Army who served in the American Civil War. A native of Gallipolis, Ohio, he is pictured wearing his military uniform. He was stationed in Nashville during the Civil War. In 1862, he was appointed aide upon the personal staff of Major-General W. S. Rosecrans, commanding the Army of the Cumberland. On September 21, 1864 he married Mary Florence Kirkman, of a wealthy Nashville, Tennessee family. The Drouillards moved to Dickson County to operate the Cumberland Furnace. They returned to Nashville circa 1886. The Drouillard family resided in a large red brick mansion located at the corner of Vauxhall (Ninth Avenue) and Demonbreun Streets. Forms part of the Nashville Room Historic Photographs Collection. 1 photograph : b & w ; 8 x 10 in.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Drouillard, James Pierre, 1839-1892
